meanings.definition: One who cancels or annuls something.
meanings.sent1: The canceler decided to call off the event.
meanings.sent2: The canceler at the airline helped me change my flight.
meanings.sent3: The canceler accidentally erased the important email.
meanings.sent4: She was a canceler of bad habits, always breaking them.
meanings.sent5: The canceler of the contract made sure all parties agreed to it.

meanings.definition: A device or tool used to cancel or erase something.
meanings.sent1: I used the canceler to remove the pencil marks.
meanings.sent2: The canceler on the computer helped undo my mistake.
meanings.sent3: The canceler looked like a small eraser but worked differently.
meanings.sent4: The canceler function on the remote control was very handy.
meanings.sent5: The canceler smoothly deleted the unnecessary data.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that cancels or negates something.
meanings.sent1: The rain was a canceler for our outdoor plans.
meanings.sent2: His apology acted as a canceler for the misunderstanding.
meanings.sent3: The canceler in the debate made everyone rethink their arguments.
meanings.sent4: The canceler of doubts, she always brought clarity to the situation.
meanings.sent5: The canceler of noise, the earplugs helped him sleep peacefully.
